title: Category delete protection, smart category icons, unified logo, and password criteria hint

requirements.summary: Protect default categories from deletion and add delete buttons only for user-created categories
acceptanceCriteria: Default categories (Work, Personal, Education, Household, Shopping, Health, Other) have no delete button and cannot be removed
User-created custom categories display a visible delete (Ã—) icon next to their name in the sidebar
Clicking the delete icon on a custom category removes it from localStorage and immediately removes it from the sidebar list
Deleting a custom category does not affect tasks already assigned to that category
The currently active category is deselected (reverts to All Tasks) if the active category is deleted

file_operations.description: Add logic to distinguish default categories from user-created categories. Define a constant array of default category names (Work, Personal, Education, Household, Shopping, Health, Other). When rendering each category in the sidebar list, conditionally show a delete (Ã—) button only if the category is not in the default list. Implement a delete handler that removes the category from localStorage via storage utilities, updates local state to remove it from the displayed list, and if the deleted category is currently active, reset the active category to All Tasks.

Add a deleteCategory utility function that removes a specified category from the user's category list in localStorage. Ensure the function accepts a userId and categoryName, retrieves the current category array, filters out the matching category, and saves the updated array back to localStorage.

requirements.summary: Use the same Task Queue logo on the Login page as displayed in the Dashboard header
acceptanceCriteria: The Login page displays the same logo image file as the Dashboard header
The logo src path on the Login page matches the src path in DashboardHeader.tsx exactly
No different or placeholder logo appears on the Login page
The logo is rendered alongside the 'Task Queue' wordmark text on the Login page

file_operations.description: Replace any existing logo on the Login page with the exact same tag and src path used in DashboardHeader.tsx. Reference the logo file at frontend/public/assets/generated/task-queue-logo.dim_128x128.png (or the exact path found in DashboardHeader.tsx) and display it in the Login page header/branding area alongside the 'Task Queue' wordmark text. Remove any different, placeholder, or randomly generated logo images.

requirements.summary: Add password criteria hint with real-time validation feedback on the Signup page
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Minimum 6 characters' hint is visible below the Password field on the Signup page
The hint text turns red when the password input has fewer than 6 characters
The hint text turns green (or is hidden/checked) when the password input has 6 or more characters
Submitting the signup form with a password shorter than 6 characters is blocked
A custom popup with the message 'Password must be at least 6 characters.' is shown when the password is too short
The real-time feedback updates as the user types without requiring form submission

file_operations.description: Add a password criteria hint text ('Minimum 6 characters') directly below the Password input field. Implement real-time validation that monitors the password input onChange event and updates the hint color: red when the password length is fewer than 6 characters, green (or hidden/checked) when 6 or more characters are entered. Ensure the hint updates dynamically as the user types without requiring form submission.

Add password length validation to the signup function. Before processing the signup request, check if the password is fewer than 6 characters. If so, return an error result that triggers a custom popup with the message 'Password must be at least 6 characters.' and block the signup flow. Ensure this validation runs before any other checks (duplicate account, etc.).
